what: Phylogenetic Flow Objects for Easy Manipulation and Modelling of Data on Phylogenetic Trees and Graphs
title: Phylogenetic Flow Objects for Easy Manipulation and Modelling of Data on Phylogenetic Trees and Graphs
text: goal phyf implement tibble subclass useful statistical modelling phylogenetic trees. mainly implements phylogenetic flow (pf) object essentially tibble one phylogenetic flow collection (pfc) columns. Phylogenetic flow collection columns collections phylogenetic flow paths (pfp), store data information flows phylogeny root node (phylogenies must rooted work phyf) tips (internal nodes). allows easy manipulation phylogeny associated data. objects used package fibre phylogenetic branch regression models, highly felxible framework comparative analysis modelling trait evolution across phylogeny.

title: Phylogenetic Flow Objects for Easy Manipulation and Modelling of Data on Phylogenetic Trees and Graphs
text: Create random phylogeny testing:  Turn tibble-based phylogenetic flow format (pf) using as_pf(): tibble easy join data using node_name, include tip labels phylogeny well ‘NodeXX’ internal nodes, XX starts 1 goes total number internal nodes. can also use node_nums join node number, node number uses traditional ordering nodes used ape package phylo objects. Usually data tips, joining pf object (using e.g. dplyr::left_join()) internal node rows recieve NA values. desired behaviour. missing values easy drop fitting model, useful later making prediction (, ancestral state estimates).
